text:
Our application runs on EJB architecture with Weblogic as our Application 
server. Entity beans access a class which needs to merge xml,xsl and 
xslparameters and gives us a wml o/p. for merging , I used precompiled 
stylesheet concept. The Pseduo code for the scenario is :


 1. In the startup class of the application, convert all xsl files to 
precompiled stylesheets and store the StylesheetRoot class in an Arraylist. 
 2. Whenever the entity bean needs it, get the corresponding precompiled style 
sheet from the Arraylist and do the following:

           StringReader xmlReader = new StringReader(inputXML);
            xmlSource.setCharacterStream(xmlReader);
            processor.setStylesheet(xslStyleSheet); // Good form!      
            processor.process(xmlSource,
                              null,
                              new XSLTResultTarget(outWriter));


It is a distributed environment for real time. It goes fine with couple of 
iterations. But after some time, it throws the following error:
